content:
I guess we should rethink the right part of the top-header where the setting icon is
how about having 3 different icons one for user setting(that will consist the manage stream, settings, organisation setting and logout ), one for docs and shortcut related stuff and the third one being toggle button for light/dark mode
this is I guess the most widely used layout these days by most of the websites
especially that theme toggling button

@Siddharth Can you give us some specific examples from other websites? I'm a little wary of having a theme-toggling button take up somewhat valuable space, since it's not something I personally ever change. But I definitely think there's room for improvement here, so I'm curious to see what other folks think of your proposal.

this is the Gatsby home page
Peek-2020-03-06-17-28.gif
if space is a problem we try adding that toggle in the settings dropdown

Screenshot-from-2020-03-06-17-34-19.png
twitter also have easy accessibility to change display settings
I think this is a good idea. "Help center", "Keyboard shortcuts", "message formatting" and "search operators" can be under one icon.
We've played with splitting this the gear men in the past, but the results have often not felt like an improvement.

is this the issue you were talking about @Tim Abbott #1368?
should I try it one more time?
Yeah, that's the issue. You're welcome to try; the most obvious split would be to move the ~7 things that are documentation to a separate widget.
